Description: Head of terracotta horse with incised detail. The head of a bridled and harnessed horse, broken from a figure modelled in the round. The eyes are prominent, the nostrils flare, and the upper teeth and the tongue are shown. Some elements of the bridle are decorated with close cross-hatching, as is the right eyebrow and the front of the mane, part of which is broken away. From a two-piece mould, with considerable hand-tooling; much of the harness has been added after the object left the mould; body hollow, head probably solid. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt; very slight traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. Near: Petrie Museum uc48053 (apparently plaster), from Memphis. Not unlike: Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge, gr.38.1887, from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3749)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
